Waterloo.KPTY (AM):
KPTY (1330 AM, "107.3 The Party") is a radio station serving the Waterloo/Cedar Falls metropolitan area with a top 40/CHR format. It broadcasts on AM frequency 1330 kHz and is under ownership of NRG Radio, LLC.


== History ==
On June 12, 1947, the Federal Communications Commission granted a construction permit to Black Hawk Broadcasting Company for a radio station in Waterloo, Iowa. Less than five months later, Black Hawk President R.J. McElroy made the launch of KWWL a reality.
